project_description: A Flutter project using the Stacked architecture, featuring internationalization, multiple flavors, and various utility classes.
architecture_overview: The application follows the Stacked architecture with separate folders for app setup, config, localization, models, services, UI components, and utilities. It uses Stacked for state management, routing, and dependency injection.

files.name: lib/app/app.dart
files.description: Defines the app structure using StackedApp annotation for routes, dependencies, bottom sheets, and dialogs.

files.name: lib/app/app.router.dart
files.description: Generated router for the Stacked architecture.

files.name: lib/main/bootstrap.dart
files.description: Initializes the app, sets up locator, dialogs, and bottom sheets.

files.name: lib/ui/views/app/app_view.dart
files.description: Defines the root widget of the application

widgets.name: AppView
widgets.description: The root widget of the application, sets up Stacked architecture and MaterialApp.

widgets.name: HomeView
widgets.description: The main home view of the application.

widgets.name: StartupView
widgets.description: The startup view shown when the app is first launched.

widgets.name: NoticeSheet
widgets.description: A bottom sheet for displaying notices.

widgets.name: InfoAlertDialog
widgets.description: A dialog for displaying information alerts.

view_models.name: HomeViewModel
view_models.description: ViewModel for the HomeView, manages the state and business logic.

view_models.name: StartupViewModel
view_models.description: ViewModel for the StartupView, handles initialization logic.

methods.name: runStartupLogic
methods.description: Runs the startup logic and navigates to the home view

models.name: Flavor
models.description: Enum representing different flavors of the application.

utils.name: ContactUtil
utils.description: Utility class for launching contact-related actions

methods.name: launchWhatsApp
methods.description: Launches WhatsApp with a given phone number and text

methods.name: launchEmail
methods.description: Launches email client with a given email address

utils.name: HexColor
utils.description: Extension on Color for handling hex color strings

methods.name: fromHex
methods.description: Creates a Color from a hex string

utils.name: Flavors
utils.description: Utility class for handling app flavors

methods.name: formatMap
methods.description: Formats a dynamic map to a String-keyed map

methods.name: fromJsonOrNull
methods.description: Safely converts JSON to an object or returns null

dependencies.name: stacked
dependencies.purpose: Stacked architecture for state management and routing

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> AppView: Launches app
AppView -> StartupView: Initializes
StartupView -> StartupViewModel: Performs startup logic
StartupViewModel -> HomeView: Navigates on completion
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Initializes
User -> HomeView: Interacts
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Handles user actions
HomeViewModel -> HomeView: Updates UI
HomeViewModel -> DialogService: Shows dialog
HomeViewModel -> BottomSheetService: Shows bottom sheet
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Stacked architecture. ViewModels (e.g., HomeViewModel, StartupViewModel) handle the business logic and state for their respective views. The app.locator.dart file sets up dependency injection, while app.router.dart manages navigation between views.
navigation_flow: The application starts with the AppView, which sets up the Stacked architecture. It initially shows the StartupView, which then navigates to the HomeView after completing initialization logic. Navigation between views is handled by the Stacked Router defined in app.router.dart.
internationalization: The app supports internationalization using Flutter's built-in localization system. Localized strings are stored in ARB files (app_en.arb and app_es.arb) in the l10n/arb directory. The l10n.dart file exports the generated localizations.
flavors: The app supports multiple flavors (development and production) defined in the Flavor enum. The bootstrap function in main/bootstrap.dart initializes the app with the appropriate flavor.
